title: Understanding Spectroscopy
text: Spectroscopy is a technique that involves the interaction of light with matter. Can you think of how this interaction might help in identifying substances?

title: Types of Spectroscopy
text: There are different types of spectroscopy, such as UV-Vis, IR, and NMR. Each type uses different parts of the electromagnetic spectrum. How might these different types be useful in chemical analysis?

hintAnswer: To identify and quantify substances based on their interaction with light
title: Purpose of Spectroscopy
text: What is the primary purpose of using spectroscopy in chemical analysis?
choices: To identify and quantify substances based on their interaction with light
To measure the temperature of a substance
To determine the pH of a solution
To calculate the density of a material
